main event: Three bright unidentified objects were sighted moving rapidly in the sky over Belmar, New York on December 1, 1953.
interesting points: The objects were described as silver or white in color and moved very rapidly in a southeasterly direction., The sighting duration was reported to be between 30 seconds to 1 minute., The objects appeared to be at a very high altitude., The sighting involved three confirmed witnesses including military personnel., No satisfactory photographs were taken despite photographic coverage being considered.
sighted object: three bright round objects in the sky
witness description: Sergeant James F. Molnar, Colonel Charles F. Stuart, Major Thomas P. Allen, all from the 5th Air Force
